title: Brand Strategy
description: Strategic brand development for tech startup
skills:
Brand Strategy,
User Research,
Visual Design

content.value: Developed a comprehensive brand strategy for a technology startup looking to establish their presence in the competitive SaaS market. The project involved market research, competitor analysis, and creating a unique brand identity that resonated with their target audience.
/work_details/1/overview1.jpg
Through extensive user research and stakeholder interviews, we identified key brand attributes and developed a cohesive visual language.
The new brand strategy led to a 45% increase in user engagement and a 30% improvement in conversion rates within the first quarter of implementation.
/work_details/1/impact1.jpg

This project taught me the importance of balancing technical excellence with human-centered design. By focusing on the user's emotional connection to the brand, we created a strategy that not only looked good but also drove measurable business results.

title: Mobile App Design
description: iOS app for fitness tracking and community

content.value: Designed a comprehensive mobile application that combines fitness tracking with social community features, creating an engaging platform for users to achieve their health goals together.
App achieved 4.8-star rating on App Store with 50K+ downloads in the first 3 months. User retention rate of 68% after 30 days.

Working on this project reinforced the power of community-driven design. The most successful features weren't the complex tracking algorithms, but the simple social interactions that kept users coming back daily.

Built a comprehensive design system from the ground up for an enterprise software company, including component library, design tokens, and documentation to ensure consistency across multiple products.
Reduced design-to-development time by 40%. Improved cross-product consistency and decreased bug reports related to UI by 55%.

Creating a design system requires as much people skills as design skills. The key to adoption was involving teams early, listening to their needs, and making the system flexible enough to handle edge cases while maintaining consistency.

title: E-commerce Platform
skills:
E-commerce Design,
Conversion Optimization,
A/B Testing

content.value: Redesigned the entire e-commerce experience from product discovery to checkout, focusing on reducing friction and increasing conversion rates through thoughtful UX improvements.
Cart abandonment reduced to 48%, average order value increased by 25%, and customer satisfaction scores improved from 3.2 to 4.5 out of 5.

The biggest lesson from this project was that sometimes less is more. By removing unnecessary steps and simplifying the interface, we made the experience feel faster and more intuitive, even though we actually added helpful features.

title: Dashboard Analytics
skills:
Data Visualization,
Information Architecture,
Dashboard Design

content.value: Designed an analytics dashboard that transforms complex business data into actionable insights through intuitive visualizations and customizable reporting features.
Time to insight reduced by 60%. User adoption increased from 35% to 82% across the organization. Training time decreased from 2 weeks to 2 days.

This project showed me that effective data visualization is about storytelling, not just pretty charts. Understanding what decisions users need to make helped us prioritize the right metrics and create meaningful hierarchies in the information.

title: Web Platform
skills:
Product Design,
Interaction Design,
Team Collaboration

content.value: Designed a comprehensive collaboration platform that brings together project management, communication, and file sharing in a unified, intuitive interface.
Teams reported 35% increase in productivity. Platform replaced average of 4.2 tools per team. NPS score of 67, placing it in the 'excellent' category.

Building a collaboration tool during remote work's rise taught me that the best tools fade into the background. Our success came from reducing cognitive load and letting teams focus on their work, not learning another complex interface.
